descript.abstract: This is an article about pika populations in Craters of the Moon and Lava Beds National Monuments. Their persistence in these areas appears to be a combination of habitat, distance to primary roads, and maximum elevation to which pikas can migrate. Population size also seems to be related to the presence of livestock grazing in some cases. Habitat quality for pikas may be compromised by consistently higher ambient temperatures (climatic change), changed composition of grasslands and significant fragmentation of lava habitats.
